title: Compare heights and times of two projectiles

content.question: Two projectiles are launched with the same initial speed from the same location, one at a 30° angle and the other at a 60° angle with the horizontal. They land at the same height at which they were launched. If air resistance is negligible, how do the projectiles’ respective maximum heights, H30 and H60 , and times in the air, T30 and T60 , compare with each other?

choices.label:
Maximum Height
 Time in Air

H30 > H60
 T30 > T60

Maximum Height
 Time in Air

H30 > H60
 T30 < T60

Maximum Height
 Time in Air

H30 = H60
 T30 = T60

Maximum Height
 Time in Air

H30 < H60
 T30 > T60

Maximum Height
 Time in Air

H30 < H60
 T30 < T60

content.answer:
Maximum Height
 Time in Air

H30 < H60
 T30 < T60

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
